comp3111.webscraper

Class WebScraper

  • java.lang.Object
    • comp3111.webscraper.WebScraper

  • public class WebScraper
extends java.lang.Object
    WebScraper provide code that scrape web content. After it is constructed, you can call the method scrape with a keyword, the client will go to the default url and parse the page by looking at the HTML DOM. It also stores the current scraped data and the results from the previous scrape.
    Author:
    Kaushal Kalyanasundaram, Kenny Li and Ruben Wijkmark

    • Method Detail

      • scrape

        public java.util.List<Item> scrape(java.lang.String keyword)
        Scrapes web content from craigslist. Updates the stored search record cache with the previous search results and updates the stored search record with the new search results.
        Parameters:
        keyword - - the keyword you want to search
        Returns:
        A list of Item that has found. A zero size list is return if nothing is found. Null if any exception (e.g. no connectivity)

      • closeWebClient

        public void closeWebClient()
        Closes all opened windows, stopping all background JavaScript processing of the WebClient that is used for scraping.

      • refineSearchRecord

        public void refineSearchRecord(java.lang.String keyword)
        Filters the stored search record.
        Parameters:
        keyword - - The keyword that the search record will be filtered by.

      • setSearchRecord

        public void setSearchRecord(java.util.List<Item> searchRecord)

        Parameters:
        searchRecord - - the search record to be set.
